item.title: I have to read the comments because so many of you have provided me with amazing advice, positivity, and help. And I hope others that are struggling read those comments too, because it can help them too. Love this community Smile, or you're doing it wron

item.title: Holding my book for the first time. ‚ù§Ô∏è This doesn't fix what I'm going through. But it definitely made me smile. I've been staring at this book on a computer for months. Cover art. Font choices. Formatting. All digital. All abstract. Now it's real. Tangib

item.title: Hope this made you laugh. It was pouring rain and I had to climb a 10,000' peak after this video. Cody and I went through some pretty intense conditions. Freezing cold rain and strong wind made for a rough night. But in the end. We were successful. Smile

item.title: Another year around the sun. 48 today. Still grinding. Still making changes. Still trying to get better every day. This year had incredible highs and brutal lows. Finished races. Wrote a book. Struggled with PTSD. Set new goals. DNF'd. Celebrated wins. As

item.title: Jackpot 100 miler was mostly paved. The dirt section was buffed out with no rocks. So I didn't use kt tape on my toes. Just @getsaltybritches lube and @feetures socks. The strategy worked out. No blisters or feet issues throughout the race. I mean, beside

item.title: Pulled off the win although I had to really work for it. 100 miles/161 km does not come easily. Especially when the race starts at 6pm. Born to Run 100 miler was an incredible experience and I will be back. #runtok #ultramarathon #ultrarunner #borntorun
item.description: Pulled off the win although I had to really work for it. 100 miles/161 km does not come easily. Especially when the race starts at 6pm. Born to Run 100 miler was an incredible experience and I will be back. #runtok #ultramarathon #ultrarunner #borntorun
